title: Unit 6: Day Trip
grammarTopics: Be going to for Plans and Intentions

theory.brief: 'Be going to' dùng để nói về kế hoạch/ý định đã quyết định trước, hoặc dự đoán dựa trên bằng chứng hiện tại. Khác với 'will' (dự đoán chung) và present continuous (kế hoạch đã sắp xếp cụ thể).
examples: I'm going to visit the elephant house. (plan)
Look at those clouds! It's going to rain. (prediction with evidence)
What are you going to do first?

exercises.question: I __________ (visit) the elephant house first.
acceptedAnswers: am going to visit
'm going to visit
hints: Use: am going to + base verb

exercises.question: Ryan __________ (see) the reptile house.
acceptedAnswers: is going to see
's going to see

exercises.question: They __________ (feed) the snakes soon.
acceptedAnswers: are going to feed
're going to feed

exercises.question: Martin __________ (see) the lions.
acceptedAnswers: is going to see
's going to see

exercises.question: We __________ (learn) what reptiles eat.
acceptedAnswers: are going to learn
're going to learn

exercises.question: Martin __________ (not visit) the reptile house.
acceptedAnswers: is not going to visit
isn't going to visit
hints: Negative: is not going to + base verb

exercises.question: I __________ (not see) the snakes.
acceptedAnswers: am not going to see
'm not going to see

exercises.question: We __________ (not go) to the beach today.

aren't going to go

exercises.question: They __________ (not watch) TV tonight.

aren't going to watch

exercises.question: Are you going to visit the zoo? → Yes, __________
acceptedAnswers: I am
we are
hints: Short answer: Yes, + subject + am/is/are (NO contractions)

exercises.question: Is she going to study tonight? → No, __________
acceptedAnswers: she isn't

exercises.question: Are they going to play football? → Yes, __________
acceptedAnswers: they are
hints: Yes, they are (no contraction in affirmative short answers)

exercises.answer: He is going to have a shower.
acceptedAnswers: He is going to have a shower.
He's going to have a shower.
He is going to take a shower.
He's going to take a shower.

exercises.question: Look at those clouds! It __________.
exercises.explanation: Use 'be going to' for predictions based on present evidence (clouds)

exercises.question: I think I __________ to bed early tonight. I'm tired.
exercises.explanation: Intention/decision already made because of being tired

exercises.question: We __________ the zoo tomorrow. We bought the tickets yesterday.
A: The phone's ringing! B: Don't worry. I __________ it.
exercises.explanation: Instant decision made at the moment of speaking, use 'will'

exercises.question: Watch out! You __________ those plates!
exercises.explanation: Prediction based on what you see now (about to fall)
hints: You can see it's about to happen

exercises.question: They __________ to Spain next summer. They've already booked it.
exercises.explanation: Already booked = arranged plan, use 'be going to'

exercises.correctSentence: What are you going to do?

exercises.wrongSentence: We're going to watching a film tonight.

exercises.title: Write about your weekend plans
exercises.instruction: Write a short paragraph (6-8 sentences) about your plans for the next weekend. Use 'be going to' to talk about what you are going to do. Include: where you're going to go, who you're going to see, what activities you're going to do, and what time you're going to start/finish.
exercises.example: Example: Next weekend I'm going to visit my grandparents. I'm going to leave home at 9am. We're going to have lunch together...

exercises.title: Make predictions
exercises.instruction: Look at these situations and write predictions using 'be going to'. Explain why you think these things are going to happen: 1) Your friend didn't study for the exam. 2) The football team is winning 5-0 with 2 minutes left. 3) Someone is carrying too many bags and they're falling.
exercises.example: Example: 1) My friend is going to fail the exam because he didn't study...
